Description: Small knob made of calcite in a flat cone shape. The base is flat and well smoothed and has a central depression with a diameter of 1.3 cm. In the centre a perforation with a diameter of 0.4 that widens at the upper side to 1.1 cm, the hole was probably drilled only from the upper side, few dark remains of a darker substance in this depression. The upper side is slightly convex, the edge towards the base is rounded and some cut marks are visible from shaping the object. The upper side is smoothed but not as well as the base.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.20A, lower floor (AWI - possibly from D14.20y)
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 111)
